name: Shankhalika Srikanth
description: Shankhalika is a Tamil-Canadian linguist. Independently and in collaboration with Sabrina Yu, she has worked with several minority language organizations to help develop language curriculum and educational materials. The seeds for Kelvi were sparked by Shankhalika's own experiences as a heritage Tamil learner and teacher.

name: Sabrina Yu
description: Sabrina is a Chinese-Canadian software developer and data engineer. Whereas Shankhalika is the linguistic “brains” of the team, Sabrina provides the computational “brawn” to turn their ideas into code. A jack of many trades, she has worked with different language groups as a programmer, content creator, and UX researcher depending on the need.

name: Madeline Solis de Ovando
description: Madeline is a Chilean-Canadian data engineer by day and digital designer by night. With a background in Visual Arts and Computer Science, Madeline works at the intersection of technology and design. She is passionate about creating compelling, user-centred digital experiences.

name: Sophia Chan
description: Sophia is a Chinese-Canadian linguist and programmer. Trained in computational linguistics, she began her career as an engineer building educational technology products in collaboration with diverse cross-functional teams. Since then she has shifted her focus to interpreting and working on culture-related projects.

name: Fizza Ahmed
description: Fizza is a software engineer building cloud infrastructure to deploy, host, and maintain machine learning models. She enjoys learning about new advancements in machine learning, from new architectures, to new practices, to new ethical standards.
